t: Hebrews 13
Let*p brotherly love continue.
Be*p not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.
Remember*p them that are in bonds, as bound with them; and them which suffer adversity, as being yourselves also in the body.
Marriage*p is honourable in all, and the bed undefiled: but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge.
Let*p your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.
So*p that we may boldly say, The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me.
Remember*p them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God: whose faith follow, considering the end of their conversation.
Jesus*p Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.

Be*p not carried about with divers and strange doctrines. For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace; not with meats, which have not profited them that have been occupied therein.
We*p have an altar, whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle.
For*p the bodies of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned without the camp.
Wherefore*p Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered without the gate.
Let*p us go forth therefore unto him without the camp, bearing his reproach.
For*p here have we no continuing city, but we seek one to come.
By*p him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of our lips giving thanks to his name.
But*p to do good and to communicate forget not: for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.

Obey*p them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.
Pray*p for us: for we trust we have a good conscience, in all things willing to live honestly.
But*p I beseech you the rather to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.
Now*p the God of peace, that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant,
Make*p you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
And*p I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation: for I have written a letter unto you in few words.
Know*p ye that our brother Timothy is set at liberty; with whom, if he come shortly, I will see you.
Salute*p all them that have the rule over you, and all the saints. They of Italy salute you.
Grace*p be with you all. Amen.
